intro: Streptocarpus phaeotrichus, commonly known as the woolly streptocarpus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its compact, bushy growth habit. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are hairy, giving it the common name "woolly streptocarpus." It is often cultivated as a decorative houseplant due to its attractive foliage and blooms.
